title: Monday afternoon Cardinal news and notes
body_text:
—Back from vacation, and the biggest piece of news I missed was that the U of L men’s basketball team will play a pair of exhibition games next month in the Bahamas.
Monday afternoon Cardinal news and notes
Bethany Marie is geeked for the return of news and notes.
“I’m excited for our team to participate in the Baha Mar Hoops Summer League in just a few weeks,” said Kelsey. “We’ve brought so many new pieces to our program and the practice and playing time this trip will allow us is invaluable to our team. It will be a vital time for us on the court, but it will also give us plenty of opportunities to gel off the court as well. I hope by taking this trip, we have a real advantage when it comes time to start practicing in the fall.”
Louisville will play against international competition as part of the 2024 Baha Mar Hoops Summer League managed by veteran sports marketing firm bdG Sports. The Cardinals will arrive Sunday, July 28 at the Baha Mar Convention, Arts & Entertainment Center onsite at the Baha Mar resort in Nassau, Bahamas. UofL will play two games before returning home to the United States on Friday, August 2.
The international opponents for the two games have yet to be determined.
Recent coaches have had different mindsets when it comes to using the exhibition tours, which programs are allowed to do once every four years. Rick Pitino loved it, Chris Mack didn’t, and I’m not sure Kenny Payne was even aware it was a rule.
For us, obviously, getting an early glimpse at this year’s team is wonderful. For Pat Kelsey, I think it can be even more beneficial.
The primary reason is fairly obvious: He has 11 new scholarship players (two are redshirting) and limited time to figure out the best way for all those parts to fit together. Seeing them in actual game scenarios should be a significant early aid in that process. Plus, going on a foreign trip smack in the middle of the preseason should help with the team-building that also needs to occur at an accelerated rate.
Then there’s also Louisville’s ability to create NIL opportunities for its foreign-born players who, by rule, can not make money off NIL in the States. U of L also has a return trip to the Bahamas coming in November for the Battle for Atlantis to make this happen.
Can’t wait for the end of next month.
—Three-game ticket packages for the upcoming U of L football season are now available.
—Louisville Athletics approved its 2025 budget Friday and began preparing for the NCAA’s future of compensating players. The CJ lays out what you need to know.
—These videos have been great so far.
—WDRB’s Tyler Greever goes one-on-one with U of L volleyball coach Dani Busboom Kelly.
—The unveil of the Louisville Regional bracket for this year’s TBT is set to go down Wednesday morning at 10.
—The entire AFC North is going to be the focus of this year’s in-season version of “Hard Knocks” on HBO.
—Nice to see these guys already getting out there and embracing the community.
—Shortly after receiving his fourth star from Rivals, class of 2025 offensive lineman Jake Cook has flipped his commitment from Louisville to Ohio State.
—Evan Miyakawa has a good read on the best way to build a roster in the modern era of college basketball.
—Coming off a fantastic result against Seattle, Racing Louisville’s annual “Fill the Fam” game is coming up this Saturday, June 29 at 4 p.m.
This year, Racing has added a promotion where kids can come on the field after the game and take a shot on goal. Also, if you’ve never been to a Racing game before, you can fill out this form and receive a complimentary ticket. If you have been to a game before, you can still get discounted ticket prices here.
—Would be a big get for the Cards.
—Will Trentyn Flowers get drafted this weekend? Experts have differing opinions.
—Malik Cunningham talks about his position switch, his relationship with Lamar Jackson, his touchdown record at Louisville and much more in this video.
—E’town native and former Louisville star Lauren Hartlage earned her first-ever Top 5 finish in a major in the final round of the Women’s PGA Championship over the weekend.
—Russ Smith is hosting a pool party at the Omni on July 7.
—More good stuff here.
—Jeff Brohm has offered a scholarship to Trinity High kicker Carson Hilbert. Hilbert’s father, Jon, kicked for Louisville in the ‘90s.
—Sam Vecenie’s mega 2024 NB Draft guide for The Athletic is here.
—Four-star safety Jontae Gilbert will pick between Louisville, Georgia, Georgia Tech, NC State and UCF when he announces his college decision on Aug. 10.
—Governor’s Cup summer smack talk: It feels like the old days.
It would be nice if the results of the actual game started feeling like the old days as well.
—247 Sports is not buying the hype on Louisville and predicts a 7-5 (5-3) season in Jeff Brohm’s second year.
—Reyne Smith had a solid showing with the Australian National Team over the weekend, netting 13 points over two games.
—Couldn’t be happier that we have another year with this guy.
—Louisville Report starts its positional preview series with a look at the Cardinal quarterbacks.
—Josh Heird discusses the 2025 U of L athletics budget here.
—Louisville baseball is getting it going in the transfer portal with commitments from a Third Team All-American and the MVC Pitcher of the Year.
—And finally, the Mike Rutherford Show makes its triumphant return to the air this afternoon from 3-6 on 1450 The Big X. You can stream it here.
